```{r setup, include=T}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = T, warning = F, message =  F)

# load in required packages
library(dplyr)
library(lmerTest)
library(multcomp)
```


# Read in data

```{r}
#Please refer to the data files we have uploaded on Github under folder "Data_Aim2" and change the directory as appropriate.
#Note: read.csv creates an extra column named X for row number, thus we're excluding it using [,-1].
#Recode Age to be a factor variable with Age 6 as the reference group.

geosocial <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/geosocial.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))

vpc <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/vpc.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))


av <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/audiovisual.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))

prediction <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/prediction.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))


word_comprehension <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/word_comprehension.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))


numeracy <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/numeracy.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))


helperhinder <- read.csv("Data_Aim2/helperhinderer.csv")[,-1] %>% mutate(Age = factor(Age, levels = c(6, 12)))

```

# Main analyses 

Main model uses package "lmerTest" and function lmer() where participant (response_uuid) and trials (Trial) are crossed random effects. 
Since main model defaults the null hypothesis as $H_0:\mu = 0$ instead of $H_0:\mu = 0.5$, function glht() from package multcomp() is used to test $H_0:\mu = 0.5$. The null hypothesis for most of the tasks (all except Word Comprehension where $H_0:\mu = 0$) was $H_0:\mu = 0.5$. 

## Geosocial 

Outcome is % frames looking at social stimulus (person_good).

```{r}
#model building 

mod <- lmerTest::lmer(person_good ~ Age + (1|response_uuid) + (1|Trial), geosocial)
summary(mod)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for the overall cohort. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12/2 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 6. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept)  = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 12. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta between Age 12 - Age 6 is different than 0. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12 = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)
```

## VPC 

Outcome is % frames looking at novel stimulus (novel_good_avg).

### Among social/face trials:

```{r, eval = T}
df <- vpc %>% mutate(Stimulus.type = factor(Stimulus.type, levels = c("Social", "Nonsocial")))

mod <- lmerTest::lmer(novel_good_avg ~ Stimulus.type*Age + (1|response_uuid) + (1|Trial), df)
summary(mod)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for the overall cohort. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12/2 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 6. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept)  = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 12. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta between Age 12 - Age 6 is different than 0. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12 = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether the effect age is different between NS and S trials. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12:Stimulus.typeNonsocial = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)
```

### Repeat the previous chunk but change NS to reference stimulus type to obtain estimates, 95% CIs, and p-values for non-social/fribble trials.

## Prediction

Outcome is proportion of trials with an AEM (aem_prop). 

### Block 1

```{r, eval = T}
df <- prediction  %>% mutate(block = factor(block, levels = c("Block 1", "Block 2"))) 
mod <- lmer(aem_prop ~ Age*block + (1 | response_uuid), df)
summary(mod)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for the overall cohort. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12/2 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
conf <- confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 6. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
conf <- confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 12. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
conf <- confint(obj)

#test whether beta between Age 12 - Age 6 is different than 0. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12 = 0")))
#confidence interval
conf <- confint(obj)
```

### Repeat the previous chunk but change Block 2 to reference block to see effects in Block 2.


## Word Comprehension

Outcome is % target - % distracter (diff). 

```{r}
mod <- lmerTest::lmer(diff ~ Age + (1|response_uuid) + (1|Word_Pair), word_comprehension)
summary(mod)

#test whether beta is different than 0 for the overall cohort. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12/2 = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0 for Age 6. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept)  = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0 for Age 12. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12 = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta between Age 12 - Age 6 is different than 0. Obj contains estimate and p-values.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12 = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)
```

## Numeracy

Outcome is % frames looking at changing stimulus (change_good).

## When five-item constant stream (bigger amount is changing)

```{r, eval = T}
df <-  numeracy  %>% mutate(Stimulus.type = factor(Stimulus.type, levels = c("Big", "Small"))) 
mod <- lmerTest::lmer(change_good ~ Age*Stimulus.type + (1|response_uuid) + (1|Trial), df)
summary(mod)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for the overall cohort
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12/2 = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 6
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept)  = 0.5")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether beta is different than 0.5 for Age 12
#confidence interval
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("(Intercept) + Age12 = 0.5")))
confint(obj)

#test whether beta between Age 12 - Age 6 is different than 0
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12 = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)

#test whether the effect age is different between small (5) and big (20) trials.
obj <- summary(glht(mod, linfct = c("Age12:Stimulus.typeBig = 0")))
#confidence interval
confint(obj)
```

Repeat the previous chunk but change Small to reference stimulus type for when 20-item is constant (small is changing)

## PLOT

Fill in the correct data and y for each task. The code produces a violin plot with individual data points of each subject, split by age groups. 

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(ggthemes)

## load source code
devtools::source_gist("2a1bb0133ff568cbe28d", 
                      filename = "geom_flat_violin.R")

ggplot(data = , 
       mapping = aes(x = Age, 
                     y = , 
                     fill = Age)) + 
  geom_flat_violin(scale = "count", 
                   trim = FALSE) + 
  stat_summary(fun.data = mean_sdl, 
               fun.args = list(mult = 1), 
               geom = "pointrange", 
               position = position_nudge(0.05)) + 
  geom_dotplot(binaxis = "y", 
               dotsize = 0.5, 
               stackdir = "down", 
               binwidth = 0.1, 
               position = position_nudge(-0.025)) + 
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  labs(x = "Age", 
       y = "Percent of looks fixating on XXX (%)")+ stat_n_text(size = 4, y.pos = 1.25)  +scale_fill_manual(values=c("dodgerblue1", "dodgerblue3")) + theme_few() + geom_hline(yintercept=0.5, linetype="dashed", color = "red") + theme(text = element_text(size = 15))+ guides(fill="none") 


## If want to use facet_wrap to split graphs by stimulus stype or block

ggplot(data = , 
       mapping = aes(x = Age, 
                     y = , 
                     fill = Age)) + ylim(-0.6, 1.8) + facet_wrap(~) + 
  geom_flat_violin(scale = "count", 
                   trim = FALSE) + 
  stat_summary(fun.data = mean_sdl, 
               fun.args = list(mult = 1), 
               geom = "pointrange", 
               position = position_nudge(0.05)) + 
  geom_dotplot(binaxis = "y", 
               dotsize = 0.5, 
               stackdir = "down", 
               binwidth = 0.1, 
               position = position_nudge(-0.025)) + 
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  labs(x = "Age", 
       y = "Percent of looks fixating on XXX (%)") + stat_n_text(size = 4, y.pos = 1.80)  +scale_fill_manual(values=c("dodgerblue1", "dodgerblue3")) + theme_few() + geom_hline(yintercept=0.5, linetype="dashed", color = "red") + theme(text = element_text(size = 15)) + guides(fill="none") 
```

Combine graphs together using ggarrange() from package "ggpubr".

```{r, fig.width= 12, fig.height=15}
library(ggpubr)
ggarrange(, ncol = , nrow = , labels = "auto", align= "hv")
```
